Asymmetric critical Idc by 10%.
Need to apply an in-plane field perpendicular to the current to see a stronger effect.

1T

1T

Asymmetry = V(I)+V(-I) at higher Idc
Asymetry is present at 0T. Where is the TRS breaking?
With Hx (I // H): strong but odd field dependence of Idc value, and relative asymmetric Idc difference (represented by peak width)
With Hy (I // H): Idc value, and asymmetric Idc difference is weakly Hy dependent. Critical field along Hy is probably high near 5T.
More robust diode effect seen at Hy > 0.6T. The polarity can can be switched with field direction.
Hy<0.6T, the sign of asymmetry fluctuates.

Compare with literature
The boxed region is equivalent to the our data taken from -1 to 1 T.
Near 0 field, the polarity is undefined marked by red.
 When Hy is small, the polarity of the diode effect is unstable.
Observation of superconducting diode effect | Nature
Switching the x/y axis

Asymmetry = V(I)+V(-I) small feature below 20nA
The asymmetry from the smaller feature  is hard to be discerned.

Data at Hy = +-0.9T
The difference between asymmetric Ic is relatively constant at +- Hy.

Measurement details:
Sweeping from +- 0.2 T

12. Field calibration
Hx= -0.9:0.2:0.9
Hy= -0.9:0.2:0.9
Linear model Poly11:
f(x,y) = p00 + p10*x + p01*y
Coefficients (with 95% confidence bounds):
p00 =    -0.00312  (-0.003551, -0.002689)
p10 =     0.02838  (0.02762, 0.02915)
p01 =     -0.0209  (-0.02167, -0.02013)
Quadratic fitting to find the minimum
 Hz_shift (Hx,Hy)

The interference pattern in Hx & corrected Hy may not come from Hz component.

Expecting some feature centered at 0.

Positive shift with Hx
The shifting is consistent with the previous more careful calibration.

20. dV/dI Hz mapping at elevated temperature
150mK

Summary of results. Date: Feb 15, 2023
Two SC features.
Bigger: Tc near 1.5K, Hc//z 0.6T, Idc near 20nA
Smaller: Tc near 0.2K, Hc//z 0.15T, Idc near 10nA, may come from some Josephson junctions?
Little-Park and Diode Effect
Little-Park like oscillations, from the edge current?
Idc Couple strongly with Hz
Dependence on Hx/Hy is unclear with/without correction
Diode effect in the bigger feature, Idc near 20nA
SC and the diode effect strengthens with hole doping
Diode effect follows the oscillation along Hz

Puzzels and next step
What is the nature of “Little Park” like oscillation? Edge supercurrent?
Why is it correlated with the diode effect?
Why is the Hx/Hy dependence somewhat random?
Next step:
Add top gate to provide an electric field tuning
Make more devices to repeat
Observation of superconducting diode effect | Nature

Measurement ideas Feb 2:
dV/dI vs bias and y magnetic field to see any diode effect.
dV/dI vs bias and z field to know if this is due to two-superfluids or device degradation(JJs will form)
dV/dI vs bias and gate voltage
Retake gate-B dependence.
Puzzles:
What is the smaller feature?
What is the causing the anomalous Hx field dependence that changes the size of asymmetry?  Sample not completely flat. Hx has a slight Hz component.
Why is zerof field IV already asymmetric?  maybe zero field offset
